subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test

messageBody:
> I think it would be useful in certain cases, sort of
> like "make -k" (keep going if an error is found).

This is not possible with JUnit because JUnit throws an exception when an assertion is not "true". When an exception is thrown, "the normal flow of the program is interrupted and that the runtime environment attempts to find an exception handler--a block of code that can handle a particular type of error." (Java Tutorial) So the next assertion is not executed.

To "correct" that, you have to change the framework (record the errors and throw an exception at the end of the test method). But I really don't think that this will solve problems:

assertTrue(obj != null);
assertTrue(obj.status() == 3);

if obj is null and you evaluate the next assert, the "NullPointerException" doesn't help much.

-Vladimir
